bf9fe445-3df3-49c9-9c80-6342ef0ea511: A fighter can choose a group of weapons and gain {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit while wielding them. As a fighter advances, they can choose additional weapon groups, or gain new unique powers.
8fa6d6eb-6d6c-4ee9-aec9-7ad29177a0d9: A fighter is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with all armor (heavy, light, and medium) and shields (including tower shields).
adcb4858-d4f0-4ab9-ba22-e97f26380cb0:
All of the fighter's allies are treated as if they had the same teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the fighter for the purpose of determining whether the fighter receives a bonus from his teamwork feats. His allies do not receive any bonuses from these feats unless they actually have the feats themselves. The allies' positioning and actions must still meet the prerequisites listed in the teamwork feat for the fighter to receive the listed bonus.
Teamwork feats include Allied Spellcaster, Back to Back, Coordinated Defense, Coordinated Maneuvers, Outflank, Precise Strike, Seize the Moment, Shake It Off, Shield Wall, Shielded Caster and Tandem Trip.
22d20709-e165-40d1-9122-8f403874cea1:
An armiger gains 1 additional {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} rank at each level.
In addition, the armiger treats {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} as class skill.
This alters the fighter's class skills and skill points per level, and replaces the fighter's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} gained at 1st and 10th levels.
230ed353-9737-43ef-8214-166024370f45:
Armigers are difficult to sway from their beliefs. At 2nd level, an armiger gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} against charm and compulsion effects. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 fighter levels beyond 2nd.
Additionally, the first time per day armiger fails a saving throw against a charm or compulsion effect, he {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} the saving throw with the same {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}.
This replaces bravery.
62ca761d-aa85-4645-b24e-b5af06b1baa4: As long as he is wielding a weapon from the trained weapon group, the fighter applies his weapon training {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
fc107c16-cb3c-493b-a5b9-09ffca4a4b1c: As long as he is wielding a weapon from the trained weapon, the fighter applies his weapon training {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throws{/g}.
01671598-ae77-4d0c-971e-f74ae2baf091: At 10th level, a swordlord can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against an opponent who hits the swordlord with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, so long as the attacking creature is within the swordlord's {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g}.
0f305ae9-ce40-4547-be60-4786d824447a: At 11th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a two-handed fighter can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, he may make a bull rush or trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against the target of his attack as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
66716dea-1bb6-4efd-8776-b2a89dd500bc: At 11th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a two-handed fighter can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, he may make a bull rush {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against the target of his attack as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
e9a719c6-5525-4d54-8f58-fb9e48d68d19: At 11th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a two-handed fighter can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, he may make a trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against the target of his attack as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
88d47d8d-cd03-49b2-b64e-8906afbadf65: At 13th level, while using a tower shield, a tower shield specialist cannot be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
bc1e2604-ccd7-42fd-b3a2-9f4c148b397e: At 15th level, a dragonheir scion can grow leathery dragon wings from her back. She can dismiss the wings as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
e145a31b-87c2-4c06-b0e7-a90055d53f82: At 15th level, when using Power Attack with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} melee weapon, the bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from Power Attack is doubled (+100%) instead of increased by half (+50%).
8f923a66-a35f-4dd3-b2a5-e74070fcde25: At 16th level, while using a tower shield, the tower shield specialist gains evasion, as the rogue class ability. If he makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that normally deals half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, he instead takes no damage.
8c813a9f-0955-4bc5-bcac-225465c97890: At 19th level, a fighter gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/— whenever he is wearing armor or using a shield.
61018ac4-45ba-4075-b3de-070826087a84: At 19th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a two-handed fighter may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon at a –5 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g}. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, it is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat. Special weapon abilities that activate only on a critical hit do not activate if this critical hit is confirmed.
cab775a6-edbe-4f11-88fa-d958cfabfac8: At 1st level, and at every even level thereafter, a fighter gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement (meaning that the fighter gains a feat at every level). These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as Combat Feats, sometimes also called "fighter bonus feats."
3210bef8-5571-4e4d-9fd9-b510ef67f257: At 20th level, a dragonheir scion's draconic heritage becomes manifest. She gains immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of her energy type, as well as {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
295a4015-5b5b-47e0-8fad-7ac8d9a1ca70: At 20th level, a fighter chooses one weapon, such as the longsword, greataxe, or longbow. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made with that weapon automatically confirm all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats and have their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} multiplier increased by 1 (×2 becomes ×3, for example). In addition, he cannot be disarmed while wielding a weapon of this type.
50354e70-fe23-43ca-af9b-62931098c401: At 20th level, the tower shield specialist gains improved evasion, as the rogue advanced talent, while using a tower shield. This works like evasion, except that while the tower shield specialist still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, he henceforth takes only half damage on a failed save.
ca927783-5bfe-4574-b151-db4d3bb43a9e: At 2nd level, a dragonheir scion gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate. This bonus increases to +2 at 6th level and by an additional 1 every 4 fighter levels thereafter to a maximum of +5 at 18th level.
4f41c064-8866-4201-8f26-163282d98583: At 2nd level, a tower shield specialist can use his shield to screen himself from burst {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects, gaining a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} against them while employing a tower shield. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels after 2nd (to a maximum of +5 at 18th level).
4f427d5b-a21c-4f02-b0c4-ff0cf023463f: At 2nd level, a two-handed fighter gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} on sunder attempts and on disarm attempts. These bonuses increase by +1 for every four levels beyond 2nd.
e7cc1820-e107-4fb2-a5ee-2943ae5981b4: At 3rd level, a dragonheir scion gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 against her energy type. At 7th level, this increases to a +2 natural armor bonus and energy resistance 10; at 13th level, it increases to a +3 natural armor bonus and energy resistance 20.
be8ba759-de8b-4355-88d1-aafab7d9fb9c: At 3rd level, a mutation warrior discovers how to create a mutagen that he can imbibe in order to heighten his physical prowess at the cost of his personality. This ability functions as the alchemist's mutagen ability, using his fighter level as his alchemist level.
e32a3967-55c2-4bb5-8d1d-9af7bb7b252d: At 3rd level, when a swordlord makes a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a dueling sword, he gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} until the beginning of his next turn. This bonus increases by +1 every four levels after 3rd.
67e459f4-f554-4a23-9163-590fbc07a091: At 3rd level, when a two-handed fighter makes a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} (with the attack action or a charge) with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon, he adds double his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
fa94c291-fb29-4e9d-8017-d537b3a053a2: At 4th level, whenever the dragonheir scion {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} a target with an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} augmented by Arcane Strike, the attack deals an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of damage of the dragonheir scion's energy type.
96ffd38c-0845-4b58-b2ae-0225f6317627: At 5th level, when a tower shield specialist employs a tower shield in combat, he does not take the –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} because of the shield's encumbrance.
8bf2b774-b955-4ecd-a20a-8d70c4b034f0: At 6th level, the dragonheir scion receives Dazzling Display as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. She does not need a weapon in hand to use this ability, and can use it as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
c7e24190-79df-4c9d-83bc-aad27e61dcb5: At 6th level, when a swordlord successfully disarms an opponent using a dueling sword, the swordlord also deals normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to the target, but without the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to damage.
a1fc8a6a-6bbc-4deb-82d0-eaebde15fe3e: At 7th level and every 4 levels thereafter, the mutation warrior can choose one of the following alchemist discoveries to augment his abilities: feral mutagen, grand mutagen, greater mutagen, nauseating flesh, preserve organs, spontaneous healing, feral wings. The mutation warrior uses his fighter level as his effective alchemist level for the purpose of these discoveries.
8eb6fa3c-2ad8-411d-9fc5-890c9bb9eb9d: At 7th level, when a two-handed fighter makes a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon, he adds double his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} for all attacks after the first.
b7e3015d-8748-43e8-89ac-bffb7e7ec3dd: At 8th level, a swordlord can throw up a blazing wall of steel to defend himself. When fighting defensively with a dueling sword, the swordlord's {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} in a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} are reduced by 2, and the dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} is increased by 2 for the same round.
29f7fcb8-ab3b-4a2c-8510-30015d157e8f: At 9th level, while using a tower shield, a tower shield specialist gains his shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g}. This does not include any enhancement bonus from a magic shield in this calculation.
da849ece-0f68-425c-b028-bb601f7d14b6: Dragonheir scions are the martially inclined humanoid descendants of those influenced by draconic power. Unlike their sorcerous brethren, dragonheir scions manifest their heritage in ways more suited to strength of arms and skill with steel than arcane energies. Those who follow this path are often the children of mighty dragon-blooded sorcerers and others who drew energy from their dragon blood, though they themselves might not exhibit spellcasting ability.
348e4950-7820-4bdb-a176-6a6be7c36a37: Each dragonheir scion can draw her lineage back to the influence of a great draconic progenitor. At 1st level, a dragonheir scion must select one of the chromatic or metallic dragon types. Once chosen, this cannot be changed. A number of dragonheir scion's abilities deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and grant resistances based on her dragon type, as noted below. If a dragonheir scion takes a level in another class that grants a bloodline, the bloodlines must be of the same type, even if that means that the bloodline of one of the classes must change.
5a971d65-248c-48b3-b612-9b909f6c8899: Fighter gains twice as many {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the other classes. Some of these feats are directly connected to combat abilities. They also have access to unique feats that increase their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit.
2a842e14-f061-49f9-a3cc-469781cc1ad1: Fighters are adept at physically damaging their enemies. They have access to a vast array of abilities which allow to turn them into either masters of melee fighting, or deadly sharpshooters. Fighters are also great at employing armor and shields, which allows them to become reliable protectors for their allies. However, they are unable to use magic, and their weak willpower make them vulnerable to hostile magic.
755767c2-7bcb-4a2d-aa32-b3622429c287: Fighters excel at combat—defeating their enemies, controlling the flow of battle, and surviving such sorties themselves. While their specific weapons and methods grant them a wide variety of tactics, few can match fighters for sheer battle prowess.
38102b04-d4d7-4d40-96ee-ea3327719bdc: Fighters make the most use of their armor. As they advance, they reduce the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for wearing it.
3ba64f88-2a2c-4951-a998-31e9130a23a6: Many fighters believe the tower shield is a tool suitable only for troops on the battlefield, claiming it is too large and bulky to use in skirmishes or within dungeon corridors. Tower shield specialists defy those notions, using their massive shields with startling skill and incredible effect. They use these seemingly clumsy shields to perform deft maneuvers that confound their enemies.
ea885880-3dc4-4e74-ab29-dab90aa5c443: Some fighters focus their efforts on finding the biggest, heaviest, most imposing weapon they can find and training to manage and harness the weight of their massive weapons for maximum impact. These fighting school benefits only apply when using two-handed weapons.
146f17ab-0b0f-43d5-b62d-eecdcb193049: Starting at 2nd level, a fighter gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} against fear. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels beyond 2nd.
64c11766-4b6b-4f36-ba57-85c8ec608d2f:
Starting at 3rd level, a fighter learns to be more maneuverable while wearing armor. Whenever he is wearing armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} by 1 (to a minimum of 0) and increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} allowed by his armor by 1. Every four levels thereafter (7th, 11th, and 15th), these {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} increase by +1 each time, to a maximum –4 reduction of the armor check {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and a +4 increase of the maximum {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus allowed.
In addition, a fighter can also move at his normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} while wearing medium armor. At 7th level, a fighter can move at his normal speed while wearing heavy armor.
e6df7926-fd05-4135-8fe3-81302718d603: The Aldori Swordlords of Brevoy are among the deadliest and most feared fighters of the Inner Sea. They have spent long years mastering the Aldori dueling sword, pitting themselves against other dueling swords and all manner of weaponry besides. Their speed and reflexes weave a net of impenetrable steel around them, from which they strike and harry their unfortunate opponents. The most common form of Aldori dueling (and arguably the easiest of the techniques to master) focuses on avoiding damage and disarming foes; these swordlords prefer to wear light or no armor, trusting their skill for protection.
196a318f-1c17-4a4d-9f14-af81da3a3dfb: The fighter applies his {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from bravery to all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throws{/g}.
69b7fa3e-62af-4037-af3e-c4d8a942ac18: The fighter gains the benefits of the Weapon Finesse {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} with all melee weapons that belong to the associated fighter weapon group. The fighter must have the Weapon Finesse feat before choosing this option.
12a2b378-572c-4d32-b9fe-be68fba9674d: The fighter treats all {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} weapons that belong to the trained weapon group as though they were light weapons when determining his {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for fighting with two weapons.
1d008e9c-67d5-4bfa-ae17-c9c33f46156b:
Until would-be Hellknights take the trial referred to simply as the Test — in which they enter single combat with a conjured devil and either emerge victorious or die — they are known as armigers. While this is a blanket term for all Hellknights-in-training (including those training to become signifers), it also applies specifically to fighters who focus their training to become Hellknights. Despite their lack of recognized rank, armigers are skilled and deadly warriors.
Most armigers live and train at their order's citadel, working toward the day when they become full-fledged Hellknights. These armigers follow a brutally strict routine; they spend hours honing their combat skills against other trainees, obsessively studying in the citadel's libraries, or memorizing passages of the Hellknight philosophy known as the Measure and the Chain. At regular intervals, squads of armigers emerge from their citadels to patrol nearby cities or frontier lands, working to enforce Hellknight law and their order's edicts.
5d4f5627-fdbf-42bc-b210-09bfcfad4d96: When the fighter is wielding weapons from the trained weapon group, his weapon training bonus applies to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against all {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g} attempted against him.
a3d24b7f-198a-4429-be11-07849b20c4bb:
Whenever a fighter {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with a weapon from this group, he gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
This group includes all crossbows.

89b88f25-9e0f-47cd-8e3f-5d20cb80b5d7: Whenever the two-handed fighter {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with a weapon from this group, he gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
6c706aa5-2e04-4e1a-8f64-881a90d02d07: While most fighters rely on physical fitness and rigorous training to achieve martial superiority, a few prefer to create and imbibe dangerous concoctions that transform them into fearsome creatures.
